member.name: T:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader
member.summary: Provides a mechanism via which CSV data can be easily parsed.

remarks.para: The CsvReader class allows CSV data to be read and parsed from any stream-based source. By default, CSV values are assumed to be separated by commas (,) and delimited by double quotes ("). If necessary, custom characters can be specified when creating the CsvReader.
The number of records that have been parsed so far is exposed via the property. Reading a header record does not affect this property.

Once a CsvReader instance is created, a header record can optionally be parsed. If a header record exists, it must be parsed first thing via the method. Upon successfully parsing the header record, it is exposed via the property. An instance of represents the header record.

If a header record does not exist in the CSV data but the details of the header are known, the property can be used to explicitly supply header information. Only one of or can be successfully used to set header information.
Data records can be read using the overloaded method. Data records are represented as instances of . Alternatively, returns data as an array of type .

The header and data records can be skipped using either of the methods. By default, skipping a record increments the record number as exposed by the property. However, you can optionally specify when invoking to ensure the record number is not incremented.
The properties and provide a convenient way to obtain instances that iterate over CSV data as instances of and [] respectively.

member.threadsafety: The CsvReader class does not lock internally. Therefore, it is unsafe to share an instance across threads without implementing your own synchronisation solution.

example.para: The following example uses one of the overloads to parse and screen dump the CSV data in a string instance:

para.code:
Dim csvData As String = GetCsvData Dim reader As CsvReader = Nothing
Try reader = CsvReader.FromCsvString(csvData)
For Each record As DataRecord In reader.DataRecords System.Console.WriteLine(record.ToString) Next Finally If (Not reader Is Nothing) Then reader.Close End If End Try

example.para: The following example parses CSV data in a file but specifies that the separator character is a colon (:), not a comma (,). In addition, it reads the first record as a header and references data via column name instead of index:

para.code:
Dim reader As CsvReader = Nothing
Try reader = New CsvReader("C:\data.csv") reader.ValueSeparator = ":"c reader.ReadHeaderRecord() Dim record As DataRecord = reader.ReadDataRecord
While (Not record Is Nothing) System.Console.WriteLine("{0} is {1} years old", record("Name"), record("Age")) record = reader.ReadDataRecord End While Finally If (Not reader Is Nothing) Then reader.Close() End If End Try

example.para:
The data in C:\data.csv might look like this, for example:
Name,Gender,Age Kent,M,25 Belinda,F,26 Tempany,F,0
The following example reads the data in a file and outputs every 10th record, along with a count of the records that have been printed:

para.code:
Dim reader As CsvReader = Nothing
Try reader = New CsvReader("C:\data.csv") Dim record As DataRecord = Nothing
While True reader.SkipRecords(9, False) record = reader.ReadDataRecord
If (Not record Is Nothing) Then Console.WriteLine("Record {0}: {1}", reader.RecordNumber, record) record = reader.ReadDataRecord Else Exit While End If End While Finally If (Not reader Is Nothing) Then reader.Close() End If End Try

example.para: The following example fills a DataSet with CSV data. The table is called "csv-data". White space before each value is preserved:

para.code:
Dim reader As CsvReader = Nothing
Try reader = New CsvReader("C:\data.csv") reader.PreserveLeadingWhiteSpace = True reader.ReadHeaderRecord() Dim dataSet As DataSet = New DataSet reader.Fill(dataSet, "csv-data") Finally If (Not reader Is Nothing) Then reader.Close() End If End Try

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.Close
member.summary: Closes this CsvReader instance and releases all resources acquired by it.
member.remarks: Once an instance of CsvReader is no longer needed, call this method to immediately release any resources. Closing a CsvReader is equivalent to disposing of it via a C# using block.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ReadHeaderRecord
member.summary: Reads the first record from the CSV source and treats it as the header for the remainder of the parse.

remarks.para: CSV data sources can optionally include a header record, which contains the names of the columns in the data. This method can be called to ensure that the first record of CSV data is treated as a header record. After making a successful call to this method, the header record is available via the property on this CsvReader, but also from the property in each instance of created by this CsvReader.

member.returns: The header for the CSV source, or if no record was found to treat as a header.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ReadDataRecord
member.summary: Reads the next data record and returns it. is returned if no more records are found in the CSV source.
member.remarks: This method will parse the next record and return it as an instance of . If the convenience of the DataRecord class is not needed, you can use the to gain a slight performance benefit.
member.returns: The next CSV data record, or if no more records were found in the CSV source.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ReadDataRecordAsStrings
member.summary: Reads the next data record and returns it as an array of strings.
member.remarks: This method may be useful if the convenience of a instance is not required. Invoking this method instead of yields a slight performance benefit.
member.returns: An array of type string containing the values in the next record, or if no record was found.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ReadDataRecords
member.summary: Reads and returns all CSV data records as a collection of DataRecord instances.
member.remarks: This method reads the CSV data into memory. For more efficient reading, it is often better to use the property, which yields an enumerator that only keeps one record in memory at a time. Alternatively, you can restrict the number of records read by using the overload.
member.returns: A collection of all CSV records as DataRecord instances. This method will never return .

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ReadDataRecords(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads and returns all CSV data records as DataRecord instances up to a specified maximum number of records.
member.param: The maximum number of records to read.
member.remarks: This method reads the CSV data into memory. For more efficient reading, it is often better to use the property, which yields an enumerator that only keeps one record in memory at a time.
member.returns: A collection of records whose length will never surpass . If there are insufficient records in the CSV data, this method will retrieve the remaining records. This method will never return .

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ReadDataRecordsAsStrings
member.summary: Reads and returns all CSV data records as string arrays.
member.remarks: This method reads the CSV data into memory. For more efficient reading, it is often better to use the property, which yields an enumerator that only keeps one record in memory at a time. Alternatively, you can restrict the number of records read by using the overload.
member.returns: A collection of all CSV records as string arrays. This method will never return .

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ReadDataRecordsAsStrings(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads and returns all CSV data records as string arrays up to a specified maximum number of records.
member.param: The maximum number of records to read.
member.remarks: This method reads the CSV data into memory. For more efficient reading, it is often better to use the property, which yields an enumerator that only keeps one record in memory at a time.
member.returns: A collection of records whose length will never surpass . If there are insufficient records in the CSV data, this method will retrieve the remaining records. This method will never return .

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.SkipRecord
member.summary: Skips the next CSV record in the data source.
member.remarks: This method skips over a CSV record and increments the record counter if the skip was successful. To avoid incrementing the record counter, use .
member.returns: if the record was skipped, or if there is no record to skip.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.SkipRecord(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Skips the next CSV record and optionally increments the record counter.
member.param: If , the property will be incremented on a successful skip operation.
member.returns: if the record was skipped, or if there is no record to skip.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.SkipRecords(System.Int32)
member.summary: Skips the specified number of records and increments the record counter for each record skipped.
member.param: The maximum number of records to skip.
member.returns: The actual number of records skipped. If this is less than then the end of the CSV data was reached.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.SkipRecords(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Skips the specified number of records, optionally incrementing the record counter for each record skipped.
member.param: The maximum number of records to skip.
If , the property will be incremented for each record skipped.
member.returns: The actual number of records skipped. If this is less than then the end of the CSV data was reached.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.EnsureNotDisposed
member.summary: Makes sure the object isn't disposed and, if so, throws an exception.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.PreserveLeadingWhiteSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether leading whitespace is to be preserved during parsing.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.PreserveTrailingWhiteSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether trailing whitespace is to be preserved during parsing.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ValueSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character placed between values in the CSV data.
member.remarks: This property can be used to determine what character the CsvReader will treat as a value separator whilst parsing CSV data. The default separator is a comma (,).

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.ValueDelimiter
member.summary: Gets the character possibly placed around values in the CSV data.

remarks.para: This property can be used to determine what character the CsvReader will treat as a demarcation around values. The default delimiter is a double quote (").
Note that the CSV parser does not require values to be delimited with this character. However, values that are delimited can contain special characters such as and .

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.HeaderRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSV header for this reader.
member.value: The CSV header record for this reader, or if no header record applies.
member.remarks: This property yields the CSV header for the current CSV data. It can also be used to explicitly set a header record rather than using .

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.RecordNumber
member.summary: Gets the current record number.
member.remarks: This property gives the number of records that the CsvReader has parsed. The CSV header does not count. That is, calling will not increment this property. Only successful calls to (and related methods) will increment this property.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.HasMoreRecords
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this CsvReader has more CSV records to read in addition to those already read.
member.remarks: This property can be used to determine whether a call to , for example, will successfully retrieve a record. It does not affect the state of the CsvReader.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.DataRecords
member.summary: Gets an instance of that can be used to iterate over the CSV data records from the current position of this reader and its end.
member.remarks: This property can be used to iterate over the data records in this CsvReader.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvReader.DataRecordsAsStrings
member.summary: Gets an instance of that can be used to iterate over the CSV data in this reader as arrays of strings.
member.remarks: This property can be used to iterate over the data in this CsvReader.

member.name: T:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter
member.summary: Provides a mechanism via which CSV data can be easily written.

remarks.para: The CsvWriter class allows CSV data to be written to any stream-based destination. By default, CSV values are separated by commas (,) and delimited by double quotes ("). If necessary, custom characters can be specified when creating the CsvWriter.
The number of records that have been written so far is exposed via the property. Writing a header record does not increment this property.

A CSV header record can be optionally written by the CsvWriter. If a header record is to be written, it must be done first thing with the method. If a header record is written, it is exposed via the property.
Data records can be written with the or methods. These methods are overloaded to accept either instances of or an array of strings.

member.threadsafety: The CsvWriter class does not lock internally. Therefore, it is unsafe to share an instance across threads without implementing your own synchronisation solution.

example.para: The following example writes some simple CSV data to a file:

para.code:
Dim writer As CsvWriter = Nothing
Try writer = New CsvWriter("C:\Temp\data.csv") writer.WriteHeaderRecord("Name", "Age", "Gender") writer.WriteDataRecord("Kent", 25, Gender.Male) writer.WriteDataRecord("Belinda", 26, Gender.Female) writer.WriteDataRecord("Tempany", 0, Gender.Female) Finally If (Not writer Is Nothing) Then writer.Close() End If End Try

example.para: The following example writes the contents of a DataTable to a . CSV values are separated by tabs and delimited by the pipe characters (|). Linux-style line breaks are written by the CsvWriter, regardless of the hosting platform:

para.code:
Dim table As DataTable = GetDataTable Dim memStream As MemoryStream = New MemoryStream Dim writer As CsvWriter = Nothing
Try writer = New CsvWriter(memStream) writer.NewLine = vbLf writer.ValueSeparator = vbTab writer.ValueDelimiter = "|"c writer.WriteAll(table, True) Finally If (Not writer Is Nothing) Then writer.Close() End If End Try

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes this CsvWriter instance and releases all resources acquired by it.
member.remarks: Once an instance of CsvWriter is no longer needed, call this method to immediately release any resources. Closing a CsvWriter is equivalent to disposing of it in a C# using block.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the underlying buffer of this CsvWriter.
member.remarks: This method can be used to flush the underlying Stream that this CsvWriter writes to.

if the record number should be incremented, otherwise .

member.summary: Converts an item to a string given an .

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.Encoding
member.summary: Gets the encoding of the underlying writer for this CsvWriter.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.AlwaysDelimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether values should always be delimited.
member.remarks: By default the CsvWriter will only delimit values that require delimiting. Setting this property to true will ensure that all written values are delimited.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.ValueSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character placed between values in the CSV data.
member.remarks: This property retrieves the character that this CsvWriter will use to separate distinct values in the CSV data. The default value of this property is a comma (,).

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.ValueDelimiter
member.summary: Gets the character possibly placed around values in the CSV data.

remarks.para: This property retrieves the character that this CsvWriter will use to demarcate values in the CSV data. The default value of this property is a double quote (").
If is true, then values written by this CsvWriter will always be delimited with this character. Otherwise, the CsvWriter will decide whether values must be delimited based on their content.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.NewLine
member.summary: Gets or sets the line terminator for this CsvWriter.
member.remarks: This property gets or sets the line terminator for the underlying TextWriter used by this CsvWriter. If this is set to the default newline string is used instead.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.HeaderRecord
member.summary: Gets the CSV header for this writer.
member.value: The CSV header record for this writer, or if no header record applies.
member.remarks: This property can be used to retrieve the that represents the header record for this CsvWriter. If a header record has been written (using, for example, ) then this property will retrieve the details of the header record. If a header record has not been written, this property will return .

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.CsvWriter.RecordNumber
member.summary: Gets the current record number.
member.remarks: This property gives the number of records that the CsvWriter has written. The CSV header does not count. That is, calling will not increment this property. Only successful calls to (and related methods) will increment this property.

member.name: T:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.DataRecord
member.summary: Represents a single CSV data record.

remarks.para: Instances of this class are used to represent a record of CSV data. Each record has any number of values in it, accessible via the indexers in this class.
If the CSV data source that this record originates from had a header record initialised, it is exposed via the property.

member.name: T:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase
member.summary: A base class for CSV record types.
member.remarks: The CSV record types and obtain common functionality by inheriting from this class.

member.name: F:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.ValueSeparator
member.summary: The character used to separator values in the implementation

member.summary: See .

member.summary: Initialises an instance of RecordBase with no values.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Initialises an instance of the RecordBase class with the values specified.
member.param: The values for the CSV record.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)

member.param: The values for the CSV record.
If , the value collection will be read-only.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.GetValueOrNull(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value at the specified index, or if the index is invalid.
member.param: The index.
member.returns: The value, or .

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this RecordBase is equal to .
member.remarks: Two RecordBase instances are considered equal if they contain the same number of values, and each of their corresponding values are also equal.
member.param: The object to compare to this RecordBase.
member.returns: if is equal to this RecordBase, otherwise .

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets a hash code for this RecordBase.
member.returns: A hash code for this RecordBase.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this CSV record.
member.remarks: This method is provided for debugging and diagnostics only. Each value in the record is present in the returned string, with a bullet character (U+2022) separating them.
member.returns: A string representation of this record.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value at the specified index for this CSV record.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.RecordBase.Values
member.summary: Gets a collection of values in this CSV record.

member.summary: Gets the value in the specified column, or if the value does not exist.
member.param: The column name.
member.returns: The value, or if the value does not exist for this record.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.DataRecord.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this DataRecord is equal to .
member.remarks: Two DataRecord instances are considered equal if all their values are equal and their header records are equal.
member.param: The object to compare to this DataRecord.
member.returns: if this DataRecord equals , otherwise .

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.DataRecord.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets a hash code for this DataRecord.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.DataRecord.HeaderRecord
member.summary: Gets the header record for this CSV record, or if no header record applies.
member.remarks: If no header record was initially read from the CSV data source, then this property yields . Otherwise, it yields the instance that contains the details of the header record.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.DataRecord.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value in this CSV record by column name.
member.remarks: This indexer can be used to retrieve a record value by column name. It is only possible to do so if the header record was initialised in the CSV data source. If not, will be and this indexer will throw an exception if used.

member.name: T:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.HeaderRecord
member.summary: Represents a header record from a CSV source.
member.remarks: An instance of this class represents the header record in a CSV data source. Such a record defines only the column names for the CSV data.

member.name: F:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.HeaderRecord._columnToIndexMap
member.summary: Maps column names to indexes.

member.param: The CSV parser to use.
member.returns: The CSV header record, or if no record was found in the parser provided.

member.summary: Constructs an instance of HeaderRecord with the columns specified.
member.param: The columns in the CSV header.

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.HeaderRecord.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.HeaderRecord.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the index of the column with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the column.
member.returns: The index of the column, or -1 if the column does not exist in this header record.

member.name: P:Kent.Boogaart.KBCsv.HeaderRecord.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the index of the specified column in this header record.
member.remarks: This indexer can be used to determine the corresponding index of a named column in this header record. If the specified column is not found in this header record, an exception is thrown.
